cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CR, cs.SI, cs.DS 

This paper is likely to belong to the arXiv CS sub-category of cs.LG (Machine Learning) as it proposes a method for verifying certifiable (non-)robustness to graph perturbations for a general class of models that includes graph neural networks and label/feature propagation. Additionally, the paper investigates robust training procedures that increase the number of certifiably robust nodes while maintaining or improving the clean predictive accuracy, which is a common topic in the field of machine learning. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) as it deals with the vulnerability of graph neural networks to adversarial attacks, which is a common concern in the field of AI. 

Furthermore, the paper may belong to the sub-category of cs.CR (Cryptography and Security) as it proposes a method for verifying certifiable (non-)robustness to graph perturbations, which is related to the security and robustness of machine learning models. 

The paper may also belong to the sub-category of cs.SI (Social and Information Networks) as it deals with graph neural networks and their vulnerability to adversarial attacks on both the graph structure and the node attributes, which is related to the study of social and information networks.
